intro: Mentha × langii var. ayassei, commonly known as Ayassei mint, is a hybrid perennial herb native to the Andean regions of South America. It is characterized by its aromatic, slightly mentholated leaves and stems that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, pale blue or violet flowers that bloom in whorls along the stems. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often used in traditional medicine for its cooling properties. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for both horticultural and medicinal purposes.
